pageContext.description: Blade 2", rivets .5" long. Leaf shaped sword with midrib. Two rivets survive on both sides of the hilt, one broken off on one side of the hilt, one totally absent. Rivets are cylindrical, bronze. Circa 6.4" not drawn of sword, broken off above the point. Breadth at end 1.2".
pageContext.other: Length: 15.7" = 398.78mm,Width: 1.6" = 40.64mm, Blade 2" = 50.8mm, Rivets .5" long = 12.7mm, breadth at end 1.2" = 30.48
pageContext.associations: No definite association, but possibly associated with 375/5, a looped flanged palstave.
pageContext.publications: Transactions of the Essex Archaeological Society, Vol. 19 (N.5), pp. 311-13, Illus.
pageContext.site: Essex,Southchurch,Thorpe Hall Brickfield,1929,Found while digging brickearth. Other Bronze Age remains, including implement, from same field.
pageContext.toSearch: Southchurch, Southend-on-sea, Southend-on-sea, Southend-on-sea Ss1, UK
pageContext.remarks: Prepared by: D.G. Macleod, Assistant-in[Chrge, Prittlewell Priory Museum, June 1958
